page.title: 04PEAT CUTTING
page.content: MAY AND JUNE ARE TRADITIONALLY THE TWO MONTHS WHEN PEAT IS CUT.ON SCORAIG MOST OF THE FAMILIES PAIR UP WITH ANOTHER FAMILY AND CUT PEAT TOGETHER.THERE ARE ABOUT 3 MAIN PEAT BANKS, BUT THEY ARE ALL PRETTY FAR FROM WHERE ANYONE LIVES.IN BADLUARACH THE PEAT BANKS ARE QUITE NEAR THE ROAD.FOR TWO FAMILIES WHO HAVE JOINED FORCES IT TAKES ABOUT TWO AND A HALF DAYS TO CUT A BANK.CUTTING PEAT IS A DIRTY,TIRING JOB.ONCE YOU HAVE CUT THE PEATS YOU LAY THEM OUT TO DRY. YOU LAY THEM OUT FLAT.AFTER ABOUT A MONTH YOU PICK THEM UP AND BALANCE THEM SO THAT THEY LOOK LIKE A TEPEE.WHEN THEY ARE COMPLETELY DRY YOU COLLECT THEM AND TAKE THEM HOME BY HORSEBACK OR TRACTOR.MOST PEOPLE CUT PEAT.IF NOT, THEY HAVE TO BUY AND FERRY COAL.
